credits.actor: Sandra Bullock, Jon Hamm, Michael Keaton, Allison Janney, Steve Coogan

programme.title: Happy Feet Two
Happy Feet
programme.desc:
Happy Feet Two: Directed by George Miller, Gary Eck, David Peers. With Carlos Alazraqui, Lombardo Boyar, Jeffrey Garcia, Johnny A. Sanchez. Mumble's son, Erik, is struggling to realize his talents in the Emperor Penguin world. Meanwhile, Mumble and his family and friends discover a new threat their home -- one that will take everyone working together to save them." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1402488/","name":"Happy Feet Two","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg1MzU2Nzg2OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzE3MzAxNg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Mumble's son, Erik, is struggling to realize his talents in the Emperor Penguin world. Meanwhile, Mumble and his family and friends discover a new threat their home -- one that will take everyone working together to save them.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1402488/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"moviewizguy"},"dateCreated":"2011-11-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Every step counts.","reviewBody":"Mumble, The Master of Tap, has a problem because his tiny son, Erik, is choreo-phobic. Reluctant to dance, Erik runs away and encounters The Mighty Sven: a penguin who can fly! Mumble has no hope of competing with this charismatic new role model. But things get worse when the world is shaken by powerful forces. Erik learns of his father's "guts and grit" as Mumble brings together the penguin nations and all manner of fabulous creatures-from tiny Krill to giant Elephant Seals, to put things right. -- (C) Warner Bros

I thought HAPPY FEET was pretty great. The film was foot-tapping fun and the dark turn it took in the third act, while unexpected, made it edgy and different for me. When a sequel was announced, I thought it seemed unnecessary. How far can you really stretch the premise of penguins who can dance and sing? Apparently, not that far. After viewing the sequel, it very much does seem unnecessary and wholly forgettable within ten minutes after you walk out of the theater, which is disappointing to say the least. Other than this, the main problem with HAPPY FEET 2 is that there aren't that many good musical numbers as compared to the first one. Most of them are pretty mediocre. However, there are probably around three that range from good to great, one of which uses the song "Under Pressure," which is easily the best number in the entire film.

Another problem I had was the dark tone of the film. It's a bit TOO dark, if you ask me. You see the younger penguin characters constantly be put in danger which made the film very uncomfortable to watch, and what these characters go through in the film would probably traumatize them for life. The film also suffers from messy storytelling. For example, the subplot with the shrimp characters (voiced by Matt Damon and Brad Pitt) seems to come from nowhere and is out of place from the rest of the film. It also doesn't help that the characters are so damn annoying. As for the 3D, it's put to good use in some places but, overall, it's really unnecessary. The one good thing I can say about the film is the look of it, which is very beautiful. I also liked Pink a lot, who gives a boost for all the musical numbers she sings in, along with Robin Williams, who has a few great jokes up his sleeves.

Overall, HAPPY FEET 2 is a disappointment considering that I am a fan of the first film. Director George Miller doesn't seem to have his heart in the right place for this sequel compared to the first film. However, the film is slightly better then CARS 2 if that says anything.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":43712,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2011-11-30","keywords":"anthropomorphic penguin,seal the animal,movie flop,3 dimensional,computer animation","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"No. 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2726469145","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxOTEwOTk3MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjk5ODQyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxOTEwOTk3MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjk5ODQyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Mumble, the Master of Tap, has a problem: his son, Erik, is choreo-phobic. Reluctant to dance, Erik runs away and encounters The Mighty Sven, a penguin who can fly. As Mumble senses he has no hope of competing with this charismatic new role model, the world is shaken by powerful forces. Erik learns of his fatherÂ’s Â“guts and gritÂ” as Mumble brings together the penguin nations and all manner of creatures to put things right."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000704/","name":"Elijah Wood"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000245/","name":"Robin Williams"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0600877/","name":"Pink"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004306/","name":"George Miller"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0248495/","name":"Gary Eck"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1668276/","name":"David Peers"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108864/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0351258/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004306/","name":"George Miller"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0248495/","name":"Gary Eck"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0171253/","name":"Warren Coleman"}],"duration":"PT1H57M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Book of Life
Manolo und das Buch des Lebens
programme.desc: The Book of Life: Directed by Jorge R. Gutiérrez. With Diego Luna, Zoe Saldana, Channing Tatum, Ron Perlman. Manolo, a young man who is torn between fulfilling the expectations of his family and following his heart, embarks on an adventure that spans three fantastic worlds where he must face his greatest fears." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2262227/","name":"The Book of Life","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkzOTgzNDYzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTgxMTkyMjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Manolo, a young man who is torn between fulfilling the expectations of his family and following his heart, embarks on an adventure that spans three fantastic worlds where he must face his greatest fears.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2262227/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"brchthethird"},"dateCreated":"2015-01-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Aggressively charming and visually creative","reviewBody":"THE BOOK OF LIFE is produced by Guillermo del Toro, directed by Jorge Gutierrez, and features an outstanding voice cast to tell its story of true love (along with a generous helping of Mexican culture). The basic plot is about two boys, Joaquin (Diego Luna) and Manolo (Channing Tatum), who vie for the affections of a girl, Maria (Zoe Saldana). As people they're fairly opposite, with Manolo being a musician at heart (his family's profession is bullfighter) and Joaquin being a soldier who does great deeds of derring-do. Unbeknownst to them, however, Lady Muerte and Xibalba (Ron Perlman) have entered into a wager about which of them can win the heart of Maria and it sets Manolo on a journey that will take him to both realms of the dead. First, I should say that the character design, animation and overall look of the film was extremely creative and visually unique, befitting a Guillermo del Toro production. The colors popped and everything in the world of the film was brought to vibrant life. The voice cast was equally impressive, although there were a couple of people who took me out of it for a little bit before getting sucked back into the story. The biggest offender was probably Ice Cube, who voices the Candlemaker, although they did stick in a couple of good jokes and references for him. I also got taken a little bit out of the story by realizing that Danny Trejo and Cheech Marin also voiced characters in the film, but again, they still did great work here. Another high point was the music. The score was pretty good, but what really stood out was the use of modern pop songs in what is (mostly) a period piece set at an indeterminate time in the past. Of course, I didn't mind that one bit at all. I also thought that the first half to two-thirds of the story were excellent. It succeeded telling an emotionally moving story with plenty of interesting characters, but at a certain point it resorted to the standard climax and resolution that wrapped up everything with a nice little bow. And despite much of the humor working, at times I felt it was a little too silly for its own good. Still, at the end I was completely won over. Had I seen this last year, I'm fairly certain it would have made my top ten. As it stands, this was an incredibly charming and visually rich film that should appeal to kids and adults alike, and also serves as a valuable cultural lesson.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":68706,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2014-10-15","keywords":"afterlife,mexico,death character,bullfight,serenade","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi840674329","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk0Mjg3ODI5M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzM1NTA0MjE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk0Mjg3ODI5M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzM1NTA0MjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Manolo, a young man who is torn between fulfilling the expectations of his family and following his heart, embarks on an adventure that spans three fantastical worlds where he must face his greatest fears.\r\n"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0526019/","name":"Diego Luna"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0757855/","name":"Zoe Saldana"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1475594/","name":"Channing Tatum"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1509613/","name":"Jorge R. IMDb data; ttnr: 2262227, Title: The Book of Life, --- Description: The Book of Life: Directed by Jorge R. Gutiérrez. With Diego Luna, Zoe Saldana, Channing Tatum, Ron Perlman. Manolo, a young man who is torn between fulfilling the expectations of his family and following his heart, embarks on an adventure that spans three fantastic worlds where he must face his greatest fears." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2262227/","name":"The Book of Life","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkzOTgzNDYzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTgxMTkyMjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Manolo, a young man who is torn between fulfilling the expectations of his family and following his heart, embarks on an adventure that spans three fantastic worlds where he must face his greatest fears.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2262227/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"brchthethird","dateCreated":"2015-01-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Aggressively charming and visually creative","reviewBody":"THE BOOK OF LIFE is produced by Guillermo del Toro, directed by Jorge Gutierrez, and features an outstanding voice cast to tell its story of true love (along with a generous helping of Mexican culture). The basic plot is about two boys, Joaquin (Diego Luna) and Manolo (Channing Tatum), who vie for the affections of a girl, Maria (Zoe Saldana). As people they're fairly opposite, with Manolo being a musician at heart (his family's profession is bullfighter) and Joaquin being a soldier who does great deeds of derring-do. Unbeknownst to them, however, Lady Muerte and Xibalba (Ron Perlman) have entered into a wager about which of them can win the heart of Maria and it sets Manolo on a journey that will take him to both realms of the dead. First, I should say that the character design, animation and overall look of the film was extremely creative and visually unique, befitting a Guillermo del Toro production. The colors popped and everything in the world of the film was brought to vibrant life. The voice cast was equally impressive, although there were a couple of people who took me out of it for a little bit before getting sucked back into the story. The biggest offender was probably Ice Cube, who voices the Candlemaker, although they did stick in a couple of good jokes and references for him. I also got taken a little bit out of the story by realizing that Danny Trejo and Cheech Marin also voiced characters in the film, but again, they still did great work here. Another high point was the music. The score was pretty good, but what really stood out was the use of modern pop songs in what is (mostly) a period piece set at an indeterminate time in the past. Of course, I didn't mind that one bit at all. I also thought that the first half to two-thirds of the story were excellent. It succeeded telling an emotionally moving story with plenty of interesting characters, but at a certain point it resorted to the standard climax and resolution that wrapped up everything with a nice little bow. And despite much of the humor working, at times I felt it was a little too silly for its own good. Still, at the end I was completely won over. Had I seen this last year, I'm fairly certain it would have made my top ten. As it stands, this was an incredibly charming and visually rich film that should appeal to kids and adults alike, and also serves as a valuable cultural lesson.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":68706,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2014-10-15","keywords":"afterlife,mexico,death character,bullfight,serenade","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi840674329","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk0Mjg3ODI5M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzM1NTA0MjE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk0Mjg3ODI5M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzM1NTA0MjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Manolo, a young man who is torn between fulfilling the expectations of his family and following his heart, embarks on an adventure that spans three fantastical worlds where he must face his greatest fears.\r\n","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0526019/","name":"Diego Luna","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0757855/","name":"Zoe Saldana","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1475594/","name":"Channing Tatum"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1509613/","name":"Jorge R. Gutiérrez"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0051162/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0215981/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1509613/","name":"Jorge R. programme.title: Hotel Transylvania 2
Hotel Transsilvanien
programme.desc: Hotel Transylvania 2: Directed by Genndy Tartakovsky. With Adam Sandler, Andy Samberg, Selena Gomez, Kevin James. Dracula and his friends try to bring out the monster in his half human, half vampire grandson in order to keep Mavis from leaving the hotel." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2510894/","name":"Hotel Transylvania 2","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNThkYmNmYzAtOGI2Ny00ODI4LTgwY2MtZmY3YWMxYTUyYjVjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Dracula and his friends try to bring out the monster in his half human, half vampire grandson in order to keep Mavis from leaving the hotel.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2510894/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"captainmike-michael"},"dateCreated":"2015-09-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Satisfying Sequel","reviewBody":"More monster characters, more amusing moments and more exciting parties have upgraded an additional star rating for the hotel this Halloween season. The animation starts off immediately from where it ended previously, progresses in a moderate pacing, filled with numerous hilarious moments though with the usual ridiculous Adam Sandler type of humors, it's not overly used and creates just sufficient amount of laughter. The message about to change and to adapt in order to fit oneself into a new environment is well simplified to cater children's understanding while the eye popping, colorful visual effects together with pop styles emerging into the story are well crafted to make young adults feel like kids. Overall, the sequel is an energetic animation compared to its predecessor, heart-warming and certainly a satisfying family goers movie to enjoy.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":117998,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2015-09-25","keywords":"hotel,vampire,party,bird,dracula","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi805482521","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg3MTcwNzU1N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzgwODEwNjE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg3MTcwNzU1N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzgwODEwNjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"When the old-old-old-fashioned vampire Vlad arrives at the hotel for an impromptu family get-together, Hotel Transylvania is in for a collision of supernatural old-school and modern day cool."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001191/","name":"Adam Sandler"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1676221/","name":"Andy Samberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1411125/","name":"Selena Gomez"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0850733/","name":"Genndy Tartakovsky"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0479739/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0121181/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0806912/","name":"Robert Smigel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001191/","name":"Adam Sandler"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0244110/","name":"Todd Durham"}],"duration":"PT1H29M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Hui Buh: Das Schlossgespenst
Hui Buh – Das Schlossgespenst
programme.desc:
Hui Buh: Das Schlossgespenst: Directed by Sebastian Niemann. With Michael Herbig, Christoph Maria Herbst, Heike Makatsch, Ellenie Salvo González. Five hundred years ago, Hui Buh cheated in a card game, thus was turned into a ghost by thunder lighting. For all this time, he has lived in the castle alone without anyone to scare. Until when King Julius moves in for his wedding, Hui Buh knows he has to use every trick of his to keep the long-wasted ghost license." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0428646/","name":"Hui Buh: Das Schlossgespenst","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDY3MGI2NDUtYmM4Mi00MzQ2LThjYWYtODAxYTI2MzcwOWVhL2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzA3Njg4MzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Five hundred years ago, Hui Buh cheated in a card game, thus was turned into a ghost by thunder lighting. For all this time, he has lived in the castle alone without anyone to scare. Until when King Julius moves in for his wedding, H","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0428646/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Equinox23"},"dateCreated":"2012-04-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"A surprisingly wonderful movie","reviewBody":"I must admit that my young daughter forced me to watch this movie and my expectations were pretty low, thus slightly bored and awkward I joined her after she had already watched about half of it...And what a surprise, I instantaneously fell in love with it.The sets are wonderfully old-fashioned and German, the thing German viewers would probably get annoyed at is that a lot of German clichés are made fun of, e.g. ghost soldiers wearing spiked helmets, a castle that is reminiscent of Neuschwanstein Castle - I felt like being way back in Texas in 1987 and being asked if Germany still was a kingdom - and if they had watched this movie beforehand, they would have definitely believed so -, especially because it is hard to tell which specific time this movie is actually set in. In a way I can imagine that this feature would be more appreciated in the countries outside Germany, I do not exactly know why but most Germans do have an exceedingly hard time laughing about themselves. 

Though the movie's namesake the ghost Hui Buh may be a little bit over the top according to my taste, the acting is superb, especially Christoph Maria Herbst as König Julius,der 111.; his timing is absolutely brilliant (and this is probably the closest he will ever get to playing a romantic lead). The humour in this comedy is at times hilarious and silly,but never ever turns nasty.

IMDb data; ttnr: 0428646, Title: Hui Buh: Das Schlossgespenst, --- Description: Hui Buh: Das Schlossgespenst: Directed by Sebastian Niemann. With Michael Herbig, Christoph Maria Herbst, Heike Makatsch, Ellenie Salvo González. Five hundred years ago, Hui Buh cheated in a card game, thus was turned into a ghost by thunder lighting. For all this time, he has lived in the castle alone without anyone to scare. Until when King Julius moves in for his wedding, Hui Buh knows he has to use every trick of his to keep the long-wasted ghost license." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0428646/","name":"Hui Buh: Das Schlossgespenst","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDY3MGI2NDUtYmM4Mi00MzQ2LThjYWYtODAxYTI2MzcwOWVhL2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzA3Njg4MzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Five hundred years ago, Hui Buh cheated in a card game, thus was turned into a ghost by thunder lighting. For all this time, he has lived in the castle alone without anyone to scare. Until when King Julius moves in for his wedding, H","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0428646/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Equinox23","dateCreated":"2012-04-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"A surprisingly wonderful movie","reviewBody":"I must admit that my young daughter forced me to watch this movie and my expectations were pretty low, thus slightly bored and awkward I joined her after she had already watched about half of it...And what a surprise, I instantaneously fell in love with it.The sets are wonderfully old-fashioned and German, the thing German viewers would probably get annoyed at is that a lot of German clichés are made fun of, e.g. ghost soldiers wearing spiked helmets, a castle that is reminiscent of Neuschwanstein Castle - I felt like being way back in Texas in 1987 and being asked if Germany still was a kingdom - and if they had watched this movie beforehand, they would have definitely believed so -, especially because it is hard to tell which specific time this movie is actually set in. In a way I can imagine that this feature would be more appreciated in the countries outside Germany, I do not exactly know why but most Germans do have an exceedingly hard time laughing about themselves. 

Though the movie's namesake the ghost Hui Buh may be a little bit over the top according to my taste, the acting is superb, especially Christoph Maria Herbst as König Julius,der 111.; his timing is absolutely brilliant (and this is probably the closest he will ever get to playing a romantic lead). The humour in this comedy is at times hilarious and silly,but never ever turns nasty.

BTW I immediately ventured to watch the entire movie... ;)","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2860,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.7,"genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2006-07-20","keywords":"surprise during end credits,ghost,castle,based on novel","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0378660/","name":"Michael Herbig","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0378698/","name":"Christoph Maria Herbst","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0538443/","name":"Heike Makatsch"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0631093/","name":"Sebastian Niemann"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0065798/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0126435/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002257/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004308/","name":"Dirk Ahner","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1743403/","name":"Eberhard Alexander Burgh","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0631093/","name":"Sebastian Niemann"],"duration":"PT1H43M"</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Magical Mystery oder: die Rückkehr des Karl Schmidt: Directed by Arne Feldhusen. With Charly Hübner, Annika Meier, Detlev Buck, Marc Hosemann. Years after a nervous breakdown Karl goes on tour with old friends and upcoming electronic music DJs. Beeing the only sober person in a environment full of drugs and alcohol starts to bring back demons." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5645006/","name":"Magical Mystery oder: die Rückkehr des Karl Schmidt","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzkzMjIxNDAtZmVhYy00YTU1LWE2NjAtOWIwYjZjM2Q5NGFlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjQ3NzUxOTM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Years after a nervous breakdown Karl goes on tour with old friends and upcoming electronic music DJs. His previous books 'Herr Lehmann' and 'Neue Vahr Süd' where made into a film and a TV mini series respectively and I found them entertaining, intelligent and funny versions of the books. When I heard that Magical Mystery Tour was made into a film I got all excited, bought a ticket and spent two miserable hours watching this piece of cinematic garbage. The film loosely follows the book and is made up entirely of stupid dialogue and cringe-worthy situations that fail to be funny. programme.title: À fond
Full Speed
programme.desc:
À fond: Directed by Nicolas Benamou. With José Garcia, André Dussollier, Caroline Vigneaux, Charlotte Gabris. A family together with their grandpa go on a vacation, when their new car won't stop and it nearly escapes crashing into a hundred cars." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4993964/","name":"À fond","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgwNzU3ZWYtMmQ4Ny00NWNmLTk3ODgtNjJjYzI1NTE4YTUyL2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjgwMzE5OTI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A family together with their grandpa go on a vacation, when their new car won't stop and it nearly escapes crashing into a hundred cars.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4993964/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Kryptorium"},"dateCreated":"2016-12-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"A comedy with adrenalin","reviewBody":"I had the opportunity to get a speech from the filmmaker (I went to the preview in Lyon) who indicated that some scenes weren't shot with a green screen. Knowing well this highway I trust him but not so much about the real speed (what's absolutely understandable according to stunts these actors accepted to do) ! This is doubtless the funnier movie of Nicolas Benamou but he has the merit to put successfully some scenes where we didn't expect to see them and to made the whole audience laugh.

I think my rate is not so high because some actors were not convincing enough and some clichés should have been enhanced further.

N.B. : some scenes are a bit violent (a child less than 10 left during one of them) ... so please avoid him that if yours is likely to have nightmares.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2969,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"genre":["Action","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2016-12-21","keywords":"family","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0305296/","name":"José Garcia"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0244707/","name":"André Dussollier"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2404839/","name":"Caroline Vigneaux"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1318381/","name":"Nicolas Benamou"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0086916/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0006560/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0418621/","name":"Frédéric Jardin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0736676/","name":"Fabrice Roger-Lacan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1318381/","name":"Nicolas Benamou"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

I also think I recognize the main actor as a standup comedian. Though I don't really know many of them, so I may be wrong with that.\n\nJust letting you know, where I stand since some may be more familiar with him. I did recognize some of the other actors and some rappers too. The movie tries its best and I don't mean that in a bad way. Surely some will like its humor and its mellow tone and silly comedy. It is quite predictable, but the characters are likeable (mostly that is) and the actors are good too. This may just float your boat, if you're in the mood for it","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":286,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":2.8},"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2018-03-29","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3985619737","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM2N2NjYTEtNzY4NC00MzQ4LThlMmQtNGQxYzQwOTRiODhiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM2N2NjYTEtNzY4NC00MzQ4LThlMmQtNGQxYzQwOTRiODhiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2977411/","name":"Nilam Farooq"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1011962/","name":"Josefine Preuß"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1391248/","name":"Kida Khodr Ramadan"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2677390/","name":"Cüneyt Kaya"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002257/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0070505/","name":"Rainer Bender"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2651653/","name":"Mathias Brod"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3429606/","name":"Stefan Höh"}],"duration":"PT1H27M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Ghostbusters II
Ghostbusters 2
programme.desc:
Ghostbusters II: Directed by Ivan Reitman. With Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd, Sigourney Weaver, Harold Ramis. The discovery of a massive river of ectoplasm and a resurgence of spectral activity allows the staff of Ghostbusters to revive the business." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0097428/","name":"Ghostbusters II","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ2NTk4MjE5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODIwNjYxMTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The discovery of a massive river of ectoplasm and a resurgence of spectral activity allows the staff of Ghostbusters to revive the business.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0097428/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ccthemovieman-1"},"dateCreated":"2006-03-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"No, It's Not The Original, But It's Still Very Funny","reviewBody":"This was another sequel that was fashionable to knock when it came out. It got panned because it couldn't live up to the first Ghostbusters. Well, what could? The first one was so original, so enormously popular than any sequel was bound to fail as far as matching it.

This second Ghostbusters was just fine, very entertaining and it was nice to see all the main characters back. It had a little nicer feel to it and was more family-friendly language-wise, so it even had some things going for it the first one didn't have.

The other major different in this sequel was watching Peter MacNichol, who reprized his "Renfield"-type character from Mel Brooks' "Dead: And Loving It" comedy with Leslie Nielsen. Here, MacNichol plays "Janosz Poha," another wacko with a thick Eastern European accent. He is hilarious, and elevates the enjoyment of this film. Otherwise, the rest of the cast plays and acts just as they did in the first film, which means you'll get a lot of laughs out of them The story just isn't as intense, that's all. No, it can't equal the original, but.....

The bottom line is this: Don't try to compare the two films. If you enjoyed the first, you'll like this.....period.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":196550,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Comedy","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"1989-06-16","keywords":"ghost,new york city,ghostbuster,baby,slime","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Ghostbusters II","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2401943065","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWUxOTJiOWEtZDY3Yi00MTMzLTk2NWItOWUxNGU4MzJmNWQ4XkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWUxOTJiOWEtZDY3Yi00MTMzLTk2NWItOWUxNGU4MzJmNWQ4XkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer 2"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000195/","name":"Bill Murray"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000101/","name":"Dan Aykroyd"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000244/","name":"Sigourney Weaver"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0718645/","name":"Ivan Reitman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000101/","name":"Dan Aykroyd"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000601/","name":"Harold Ramis"}],"duration":"PT1H48M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0097428, Title: Ghostbusters II, --- Description: Ghostbusters II: Directed by Ivan Reitman. With Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd, Sigourney Weaver, Harold Ramis. The discovery of a massive river of ectoplasm and a resurgence of spectral activity allows the staff of Ghostbusters to revive the business." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0097428/","name":"Ghostbusters II","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ2NTk4MjE5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODIwNjYxMTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The discovery of a massive river of ectoplasm and a resurgence of spectral activity allows the staff of Ghostbusters to revive the business.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0097428/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"ccthemovieman-1","dateCreated":"2006-03-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"No, It's Not The Original, But It's Still Very Funny","reviewBody":"This was another sequel that was fashionable to knock when it came out. It got panned because it couldn't live up to the first Ghostbusters. Well, what could? The first one was so original, so enormously popular than any sequel was bound to fail as far as matching it.

This second Ghostbusters was just fine, very entertaining and it was nice to see all the main characters back. It had a little nicer feel to it and was more family-friendly language-wise, so it even had some things going for it the first one didn't have.

The other major different in this sequel was watching Peter MacNichol, who reprized his "Renfield"-type character from Mel Brooks' "Dead: And Loving It" comedy with Leslie Nielsen. Here, MacNichol plays "Janosz Poha," another wacko with a thick Eastern European accent. He is hilarious, and elevates the enjoyment of this film. Otherwise, the rest of the cast plays and acts just as they did in the first film, which means you'll get a lot of laughs out of them The story just isn't as intense, that's all. No, it can't equal the original, but.....

The bottom line is this: Don't try to compare the two films. If you enjoyed the first, you'll like this.....period.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":196550,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Comedy","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"1989-06-16","keywords":"ghost,new york city,ghostbuster,baby,slime","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Ghostbusters II","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2401943065","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWUxOTJiOWEtZDY3Yi00MTMzLTk2NWItOWUxNGU4MzJmNWQ4XkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWUxOTJiOWEtZDY3Yi00MTMzLTk2NWItOWUxNGU4MzJmNWQ4XkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer 2","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000195/","name":"Bill Murray","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000101/","name":"Dan Aykroyd","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000244/","name":"Sigourney Weaver"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0718645/","name":"Ivan Reitman"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000101/","name":"Dan Aykroyd","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000601/","name":"Harold Ramis"],"duration":"PT1H48M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Ghostbusters
Ghostbusters – Die Geisterjäger
programme.desc:
Ghostbusters: Directed by Ivan Reitman. With Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd, Sigourney Weaver, Harold Ramis. Three parapsychologists forced out of their university funding set up shop as a unique ghost removal service in New York City, attracting frightened yet skeptical customers." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0087332/","name":"Ghostbusters","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkxMjYyNzgwMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTE3MjYyMTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three parapsychologists forced out of their university funding set up shop as a unique ghost removal service in New York City, attracting frightened yet skeptical customers.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0087332/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"magic_marker"},"dateCreated":"2002-09-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"A severely underrated film","reviewBody":"What's that you say? Ghostbusters, one of the most financially successful and over-hyped comedies of the eighties, underrated? Yes. Precicely because it was so over-hyped and made so much money, there has been a stigma attached to this film identifying it as a childish FX piece, when it is nothing of the sort. Most of the lines people remember("He slimed me," "OK. So? She's a dog," "When someone asks you if you're a god, you say YES!") are not its funniest or wittiest lines, which often are missed on first or even second viewing. I laugh every time I observe a gag or a quip that I somehow missed the other 20 times I viewed a scene; "Egon, this reminds me of the time you tried to drill a hole through your head, remember that?" "That would have worked if you hadn't stopped me", or, to the driver of a van from a loony bin, "Dropping off or picking up?" Brilliant.

Not only is Ghostbusters funny, it manages to include some truly scary scenes. And not just lose-your-popcorn moments like the fridge from Hell, but also scenes of quiet, thoughtful chill, like Egon's retelling of how the possessed apartment building came into being, or Winston recalling the Book of Revelation. Which other film has managed to combine the Marx Brothers with HP Lovecraft?

The special effects hold up well, besides some obvious studio sets and models, but what really creates this film's world is the stunning cinematography. Manhattan, perhaps the pinnacle of Gothic architectural evolution, is brilliantly utilised here to create a sense of menacing grandeur. After watching "Ghostbusters" I couldn't imagine the realm of the Old Gods opening into our world from anywhere else. The soundtrack is great, not the overrated theme (Which was in fact lifted from Huey Lewis' "I Need a New Drug"), but the wonderfully blusey "Cleaning Up the Town," the creepy proto-techno chiller "Magic" and also the wonderful score by the late and much lamented Elmer Bernstein.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":388492,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Comedy","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"1984-06-08","keywords":"ghost,ghostbuster,scientist,paranormal investigation team,supernatural being","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"30th Anniversary Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2800593945","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgxNTM3MDUxNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDgwMDgxMjE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgxNTM3MDUxNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDgwMDgxMjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Watch the 30th Anniversary Trailer for Ghostbusters."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000195/","name":"Bill Murray"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000101/","name":"Dan Aykroyd"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000244/","name":"Sigourney Weaver"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0718645/","name":"Ivan Reitman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0147858/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0012330/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000101/","name":"Dan Aykroyd"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000601/","name":"Harold Ramis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001548/","name":"Rick Moranis"}],"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Paul Blart: Mall Cop
Der Kaufhaus Cop
programme.desc: Paul Blart: Mall Cop: Directed by Steve Carr. With Kevin James, Keir O'Donnell, Jayma Mays, Raini Rodriguez. When a shopping mall is taken over by a gang of organized crooks, it's up to a mild-mannered security guard to save the day." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1114740/","name":"Paul Blart: Mall Cop","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM2NzA1MzE1NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTYyNDIzMg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a shopping mall is taken over by a gang of organized crooks, it's up to a mild-mannered security guard to save the day.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1114740/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"poolhus"},"dateCreated":"2009-01-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not A Kevin James fan, this is a positive review","reviewBody":"Never watched King of Queens, never have been a Kevin James fan but always liked him better than his pal Ray Romano. I was coerced into seeing this Mall Cop movie. I give it a 6 out of 10. Now some may say that is a low rating, some may say better than mediocre.....for me who normally does not like this guys type of humor, this is a great rating!!! It was mildly entertaining...for me it gets the extra star to put it at 6 because it's refreshing to see some humor that's not overly sarcastic, deeply degrading to someone else (except the title character), or just downright cruel. This relied on what I call "Bill Cosby" sense of humor. Funny but overall clean. A bit cheesy, but I think that's what Kevin and the screenwriters were going for. Normally I don't get why people think he's funny but in this case, I did get it....and you can't help but like the guy. Without giving any detail, the bar scene for me was one of the most Laugh Out Loud moments in the movie. The way KJ zips around on the Segway is pretty hilarious although because of it's consistency throughout the movie it wears off a bit. I agree with previous reviews of how the villains kind of downgraded the movie a bit. If that was smarter, or those parts were rewritten, it could have been a lot funnier. Another surprising aspect is Kevin's agility, and athleticism. In this particular movie he is very physical (or at least stunt doubles allow him to appear that way) Overall my 6 out of 10 rating should be perceived as a great rating for this movie. I previously never liked this actor, I thought the title was dumb as dirt, and although I always keep an open mind I would be lying if I didn't say that my expectations were very, very low for this. Certainly not as bad as I thought it would be, and not as great as I thought it could have been. Kevin and cast made this a little better than average...and it changed my mind about my hesitation with this guy....I hope someone puts him in a good movie with a great script in the future (better than Chuck and Larry, Hitch). I believe it will do well on cable. One last thing that I must mention was great, at 82 mins...it was just long enough to not overdue what should be viewed as a kinda silly concept.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":107537,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.2},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2009-04-15","keywords":"mall cop,reference to scooby doo,single father,die hard scenario,comic violence","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"DVD Trailer: Paul Blart: Mall Cop","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1000931865","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI5ODYwNzIzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTA5MjU1Mg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI5ODYwNzIzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTA5MjU1Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a shopping mall is overtaken by a gang of organized crooks, it's up to the a mild-mannered security guard to save the day."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0416673/","name":"Kevin James"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1218757/","name":"Keir O'Donnell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1724323/","name":"Jayma Mays"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0139867/","name":"Steve Carr"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0059609/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0416673/","name":"Kevin James"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0048169/","name":"Nick Bakay"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

But safety never takes a holiday and when duty calls, Blart a","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3450650/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Tyypo"},"dateCreated":"2016-01-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Come on, it wasn't that bad...","reviewBody":"With the reviews here, I was expecting a terrible movie. I probably wouldn't have bothered with it but it was a free On Demand option recently. The worst thing about it was the lengthy setup, with plenty of exposition from the previous film followed by a lot of nothing before the actual story takes place. Once that began, I thought it had reasonably funny moments reminiscent of the original. I also appreciated that it had no memorable profanity that would have made it unsuitable for children, like so many "family" films these days. programme.title: I Now Pronounce You Chuck & Larry
Chuck und Larry – Wie Feuer und Flamme
programme.desc:
I Now Pronounce You Chuck & Larry: Directed by Dennis Dugan. With Adam Sandler, Kevin James, Jessica Biel, Dan Aykroyd. Two straight, single Brooklyn firefighters pretend to be a gay couple in order to receive domestic partner benefits." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0762107/","name":"I Now Pronounce You Chuck & Larry","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM4NDQ3NDQ3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjE4NjY0MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two straight, single Brooklyn firefighters pretend to be a gay couple in order to receive domestic partner benefits.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0762107/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"treeskier802"},"dateCreated":"2007-07-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"An Average Comedy","reviewBody":"This film is basically an average comedy. You can poke a lot of holes in the plot and there is a lot of stupidity. Yet, there are some parts that make you laugh out loud. This is an entertaining film, but your own sense of humor should dictate whether you want to see it or not.

Sandler and James play New York firefighters. The basic premise is that Kevin James' character finds a loophole in the system so that if he marries Sandler, his children will easily get his employee benefits. Without a wife, his children would be held in limbo by the state for a while before they get any benefits. This, of course, is a stretch, but since it is a comedy you just kind of go with it.

So after James saves Sandler's life, Sandler agrees to go through with this. This is where the gay jokes ensue. Add in Ving Rhames who is a gay firefighter who comes out of the closet due to James and Sandler and also add in Jessica Biel as some eye candy who Sandler badly wants to date and you have all the ingredients of this comedy. Rob Schneider is funny playing an Asian minister. This movie is pro-gay I would say, so it shouldn't offend homosexuals, and Schneider is part Asian, so I guess he is supposed to be off the hook for making fun of that ethnic group. Anyway, all the jokes are supposed to be in good fun, but some people might get offended. If you are the type of person who gets offended easily, then you probably should avoid this movie.

Some nice cameos in the film and the soundtrack is largely comprised of known gay artists.

I saw this in the theater with my girlfriend. You would probably be smart to avoid the pricey theater tickets and wait until this comes out on DVD. This is not going to be a classic comedy and is not close to one of Sandler's best. At the same time, I don't think that it is an awful film either. Rating 6 0f 10 stars.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":145022,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2007-08-22","keywords":"insurance,womanizer,hand gesture imitating sex,camera focus on cleavage,porn magazine","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi262668569","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzUzZDg0ZGQtNmQ2My00YTk1LTg1NGEtZmZlZTg3ZWM3NTU4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzUzZDg0ZGQtNmQ2My00YTk1LTg1NGEtZmZlZTg3ZWM3NTU4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Universal Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001191/","name":"Adam Sandler"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0416673/","name":"Kevin James"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004754/","name":"Jessica Biel"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0240797/","name":"Dennis Dugan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0059609/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0266673/","name":"Barry Fanaro"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0668247/","name":"Alexander Payne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0852591/","name":"Jim Taylor"}],"duration":"PT1H55M"}</script><metacontent="

Two straight, single Brooklyn firefighters pretend to be a gay couple in order to receive domestic partner benefits." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0762107/","name":"I Now Pronounce You Chuck & Larry","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM4NDQ3NDQ3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjE4NjY0MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two straight, single Brooklyn firefighters pretend to be a gay couple in order to receive domestic partner benefits.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0762107/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"treeskier802","dateCreated":"2007-07-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"An Average Comedy","reviewBody":"This film is basically an average comedy. You can poke a lot of holes in the plot and there is a lot of stupidity. Yet, there are some parts that make you laugh out loud. This is an entertaining film, but your own sense of humor should dictate whether you want to see it or not.

Sandler and James play New York firefighters. The basic premise is that Kevin James' character finds a loophole in the system so that if he marries Sandler, his children will easily get his employee benefits. Without a wife, his children would be held in limbo by the state for a while before they get any benefits. This, of course, is a stretch, but since it is a comedy you just kind of go with it.

So after James saves Sandler's life, Sandler agrees to go through with this. This is where the gay jokes ensue. Add in Ving Rhames who is a gay firefighter who comes out of the closet due to James and Sandler and also add in Jessica Biel as some eye candy who Sandler badly wants to date and you have all the ingredients of this comedy. Rob Schneider is funny playing an Asian minister. This movie is pro-gay I would say, so it shouldn't offend homosexuals, and Schneider is part Asian, so I guess he is supposed to be off the hook for making fun of that ethnic group. Anyway, all the jokes are supposed to be in good fun, but some people might get offended. If you are the type of person who gets offended easily, then you probably should avoid this movie.

Some nice cameos in the film and the soundtrack is largely comprised of known gay artists.

I saw this in the theater with my girlfriend. You would probably be smart to avoid the pricey theater tickets and wait until this comes out on DVD. This is not going to be a classic comedy and is not close to one of Sandler's best. At the same time, I don't think that it is an awful film either. Rating 6 0f 10 stars.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":145022,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2007-08-22","keywords":"insurance,womanizer,hand gesture imitating sex,camera focus on cleavage,porn magazine","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi262668569","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzUzZDg0ZGQtNmQ2My00YTk1LTg1NGEtZmZlZTg3ZWM3NTU4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzUzZDg0ZGQtNmQ2My00YTk1LTg1NGEtZmZlZTg3ZWM3NTU4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Universal Pictures","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001191/","name":"Adam Sandler","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0416673/","name":"Kevin James","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004754/","name":"Jessica Biel"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0240797/","name":"Dennis Dugan"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0059609/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0266673/","name":"Barry Fanaro","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0668247/","name":"Alexander Payne","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0852591/","name":"Jim Taylor"],"duration":"PT1H55M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: An American Pickle
An American Pickle
programme.desc: An American Pickle: Directed by Brandon Trost. With Seth Rogen, Sarah Snook, Molly Evensen, Eliot Glazer. An immigrant worker at a pickle factory is accidentally preserved for 100 years and wakes up in modern-day Brooklyn." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9059704/","name":"An American Pickle","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmRkZmZiNzUtMzgwYy00NTEzLWE2NjctMmI3NGI5ZTBiNDdkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzE3ODQxNjU@._V1_.jpg","description":"An immigrant worker at a pickle factory is accidentally preserved for 100 years and wakes up in modern-day Brooklyn.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9059704/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"DeadMansTrousers"},"dateCreated":"2020-08-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"Nothing amazing but it was enjoyable","reviewBody":"As others have pointed out this is not your typical Seth Rogen film. This is his attempt to make a fish out of water story in the style of Splash or Big and while he doesn't reinvent the wheel in doing so there were some enjoyable moments. This is obviously meant to be a film which you can watch with you family, it is not vulgar and it focuses on the importance of family values and relationships. There are many moments/jokes in this film that have to do with Judaism which Seth has joked about previously, but here this is much more of a love note to that part of his life. I think maybe some of the negativity being directed at this film is because some people don't understand that aspect of it. They instead are expecting the normal stoner humour Seth Rogen. I think this movie is worth watching if you want to see a different side of Seth and don't mind seeing the things I mentioned.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":21175,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2020-08-06","keywords":"time travel,time traveler,immigrant,jewish,brooklyn","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3105799705","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODU3MWM3MmYtYTdiNi00YmI4LWI2MTMtMjYzNzM4OTE1NzdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODU3MWM3MmYtYTdiNi00YmI4LWI2MTMtMjYzNzM4OTE1NzdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"AN AMERICAN PICKLE, directed by Brandon Trost, is based on Simon Rich's New Yorker novella and stars Seth Rogen as Herschel Greenbaum, a struggling laborer who immigrates to America in 1920 with dreams of building a better life for his beloved family. One day, while working at his factory job, he falls into a vat of pickles and is brined for 100 years. The brine preserves him perfectly and when he emerges in present-day Brooklyn, he finds that he hasn't aged a day. But when he seeks out his family, he is troubled to learn that his only surviving relative is his great-grandson, Ben Greenbaum (also played by Rogen), a mild-mannered computer coder whom Herschel can't even begin to understand."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0736622/","name":"Seth Rogen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3512758/","name":"Sarah Snook"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6127780/","name":"Molly Evensen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1060930/","name":"Brandon Trost"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0345956/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0719807/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026545/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2919995/","name":"Simon Rich"}],"duration":"PT1H28M"}</script><metacontent="

This is his attempt to make a fish out of water story in the style of Splash or Big and while he doesn't reinvent the wheel in doing so there were some enjoyable moments. This is obviously meant to be a film which you can watch with you family, it is not vulgar and it focuses on the importance of family values and relationships. There are many moments/jokes in this film that have to do with Judaism which Seth has joked about previously, but here this is much more of a love note to that part of his life. I think maybe some of the negativity being directed at this film is because some people don't understand that aspect of it. They instead are expecting the normal stoner humour Seth Rogen. I think this movie is worth watching if you want to see a different side of Seth and don't mind seeing the things I mentioned.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":21175,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2020-08-06","keywords":"time travel,time traveler,immigrant,jewish,brooklyn","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3105799705","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODU3MWM3MmYtYTdiNi00YmI4LWI2MTMtMjYzNzM4OTE1NzdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODU3MWM3MmYtYTdiNi00YmI4LWI2MTMtMjYzNzM4OTE1NzdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"AN AMERICAN PICKLE, directed by Brandon Trost, is based on Simon Rich's New Yorker novella and stars Seth Rogen as Herschel Greenbaum, a struggling laborer who immigrates to America in 1920 with dreams of building a better life for his beloved family. One day, while working at his factory job, he falls into a vat of pickles and is brined for 100 years. The brine preserves him perfectly and when he emerges in present-day Brooklyn, he finds that he hasn't aged a day. Though I don't really know many of them, so I may be wrong with that.\n\nJust letting you know, where I stand since some may be more familiar with him. I did recognize some of the other actors and some rappers too. The movie tries its best and I don't mean that in a bad way. Surely some will like its humor and its mellow tone and silly comedy. It is quite predictable, but the characters are likeable (mostly that is) and the actors are good too. Beeing the only sober person in a environment full of drugs and alcohol starts to bring back demons." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5645006/","name":"Magical Mystery oder: die Rückkehr des Karl Schmidt","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzkzMjIxNDAtZmVhYy00YTU1LWE2NjAtOWIwYjZjM2Q5NGFlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjQ3NzUxOTM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Years after a nervous breakdown Karl goes on tour with old friends and upcoming electronic music DJs. Beeing the only sober person in a environment full of drugs and alcohol starts to bring back demons.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5645006/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"tablemountain1912"},"dateCreated":"2017-09-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Magical Misery Tour","reviewBody":"The film is based on a Sven Regener book whom I regard one of the better contemporary authors in Germany. His previous books 'Herr Lehmann' and 'Neue Vahr Süd' where made into a film and a TV mini series respectively and I found them entertaining, intelligent and funny versions of the books. When I heard that Magical Mystery Tour was made into a film I got all excited, bought a ticket and spent two miserable hours watching this piece of cinematic garbage. There are some glimpses of hope, mainly in the beginning, but it doesn't last long. The film loosely follows the book and is made up entirely of stupid dialogue and cringe-worthy situations that fail to be funny. When I heard that Magical Mystery Tour was made into a film I got all excited, bought a ticket and spent two miserable hours watching this piece of cinematic garbage. There are some glimpses of hope, mainly in the beginning, but it doesn't last long. The film loosely follows the book and is made up entirely of stupid dialogue and cringe-worthy situations that fail to be funny. Not a highlight of German cinema.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":2,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":869,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6,"genre":["Comedy","Drama","Music"],"datePublished":"2017-08-31","keywords":"female nudity,topless female nudity,smoking after sex,smoking in bed","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3556818713","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGFhZTBiNzUtNjE3My00ZTAzLWJkMTYtNzFlMTE3OTE2ODM2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGFhZTBiNzUtNjE3My00ZTAzLWJkMTYtNzFlMTE3OTE2ODM2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1554735/","name":"Charly Hübner","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6103700/","name":"Annika Meier","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0118345/","name":"Detlev Buck"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0270990/","name":"Arne Feldhusen"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0061958/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0164664/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0254210/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1210638/","name":"Sven Regener"],"duration":"PT1H51M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Paul Blart: Mall Cop
Der Kaufhaus Cop
programme.desc: Paul Blart: Mall Cop: Directed by Steve Carr. With Kevin James, Keir O'Donnell, Jayma Mays, Raini Rodriguez. When a shopping mall is taken over by a gang of organized crooks, it's up to a mild-mannered security guard to save the day." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1114740/","name":"Paul Blart: Mall Cop","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM2NzA1MzE1NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTYyNDIzMg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a shopping mall is taken over by a gang of organized crooks, it's up to a mild-mannered security guard to save the day.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1114740/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"poolhus"},"dateCreated":"2009-01-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not A Kevin James fan, this is a positive review","reviewBody":"Never watched King of Queens, never have been a Kevin James fan but always liked him better than his pal Ray Romano. I was coerced into seeing this Mall Cop movie. I give it a 6 out of 10. Now some may say that is a low rating, some may say better than mediocre.....for me who normally does not like this guys type of humor, this is a great rating!!! It was mildly entertaining...for me it gets the extra star to put it at 6 because it's refreshing to see some humor that's not overly sarcastic, deeply degrading to someone else (except the title character), or just downright cruel. This relied on what I call "Bill Cosby" sense of humor. Funny but overall clean. A bit cheesy, but I think that's what Kevin and the screenwriters were going for. Normally I don't get why people think he's funny but in this case, I did get it....and you can't help but like the guy. Without giving any detail, the bar scene for me was one of the most Laugh Out Loud moments in the movie. The way KJ zips around on the Segway is pretty hilarious although because of it's consistency throughout the movie it wears off a bit. I agree with previous reviews of how the villains kind of downgraded the movie a bit. If that was smarter, or those parts were rewritten, it could have been a lot funnier. Another surprising aspect is Kevin's agility, and athleticism. In this particular movie he is very physical (or at least stunt doubles allow him to appear that way) Overall my 6 out of 10 rating should be perceived as a great rating for this movie. I previously never liked this actor, I thought the title was dumb as dirt, and although I always keep an open mind I would be lying if I didn't say that my expectations were very, very low for this. Certainly not as bad as I thought it would be, and not as great as I thought it could have been. Kevin and cast made this a little better than average...and it changed my mind about my hesitation with this guy....I hope someone puts him in a good movie with a great script in the future (better than Chuck and Larry, Hitch). I believe it will do well on cable. One last thing that I must mention was great, at 82 mins...it was just long enough to not overdue what should be viewed as a kinda silly concept.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":107537,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.2},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2009-04-15","keywords":"mall cop,reference to scooby doo,single father,die hard scenario,comic violence","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"DVD Trailer: Paul Blart: Mall Cop","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1000931865","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI5ODYwNzIzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTA5MjU1Mg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI5ODYwNzIzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTA5MjU1Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a shopping mall is overtaken by a gang of organized crooks, it's up to the a mild-mannered security guard to save the day."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0416673/","name":"Kevin James"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1218757/","name":"Keir O'Donnell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1724323/","name":"Jayma Mays"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0139867/","name":"Steve Carr"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0059609/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0416673/","name":"Kevin James"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0048169/","name":"Nick Bakay"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Paul Blart: Mall Cop 2: Directed by Andy Fickman. With Kevin James, Raini Rodriguez, Neal McDonough, Daniella Alonso. But safety never takes a holiday and when duty calls, Blart answers." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3450650/","name":"Paul Blart: Mall Cop 2","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkwMjkxNDQ1MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDQwODIxNTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"After six years of keeping our malls safe, Paul Blart has earned a well-deserved vacation. But safety never takes a holiday and when duty calls, Blart a","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3450650/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Tyypo"},"dateCreated":"2016-01-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Come on, it wasn't that bad...","reviewBody":"With the reviews here, I was expecting a terrible movie. I probably wouldn't have bothered with it but it was a free On Demand option recently. The worst thing about it was the lengthy setup, with plenty of exposition from the previous film followed by a lot of nothing before the actual story takes place. Once that began, I thought it had reasonably funny moments reminiscent of the original. I also appreciated that it had no memorable profanity that would have made it unsuitable for children, like so many "family" films these days. Ballermann 6
programme.desc: Ballermann 6: Directed by Gernot Roll, Tom Gerhardt. With Tom Gerhardt, Hilmi Sözer, Christoph M. Ohrt, Diana Frank. Scrambling up their last money, two dudes journey to Mallorca to fullfill their dream and participate in Europe's most famous beach parties." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0118678/","name":"Ballermann 6","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEzMTUyMDA0MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzI4NjcxMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Scrambling up their last money, two dudes journey to Mallorca to fullfill their dream and participate in Europe's most famous beach parties.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0118678/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bscrooked"},"dateCreated":"2021-09-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"I love it","reviewBody":"I first saw this movie when I was like 15, 16 years old, partying on Mallorca/ at the Ballermann was an absolute highlight. I absolutely love the humor in this one, it's so stupid, I'm still dying over it every single time - and watched the movie uncountable times. Both main characters are absolutely hilarious. Over the top, but you can easily like them. I didn't like their two other movies "voll normaaal" and especially "die superbullen" very well, but they definitely nailed it with Ballermann 6. If you can get into the snese of humor, you've at least got to like it. programme.title: Miss Congeniality
Miss Undercover
programme.desc:
Miss Congeniality: Directed by Donald Petrie. With Sandra Bullock, Michael Caine, Benjamin Bratt, Candice Bergen. An F.B.I. Agent must go undercover in the Miss United States beauty pageant to prevent a group from bombing the event." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0212346/","name":"Miss Congeniality","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDhjNzc4N2MtNWE5ZC00N2M4LWFiYjEtMTE5YmYyMTg3OGY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkzODUwNzk@._V1_.jpg","description":"An F.B.I. Agent must go undercover in the Miss United States beauty pageant to prevent a group from bombing the event.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0212346/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"hitchcockthelegend"},"dateCreated":"2015-07-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"The last time I was this naked in public I was coming out of a uterus!","reviewBody":"Miss Congeniality finds Sandra Bullock as FBI Agent Gracie Hart, who must go undercover in the Miss United States beauty pageant to prevent a psychopath from committing untold homicide.

The premise is simple, it's a Pygmalion/My Fair Lady scenario that transforms the rough and tough Gracie into a viable contestant for the pageant. Thus we have all the comedy that comes with her literally battling everyone, including her own opinions on pageants, as she is being asked to be something she doesn't believe is in her make up. The mystery of who the killer is who's on the loose is strong for a good portion of film, and even once it's known and drama takes centre stage, it's still hard to get the smile off of your face. 

The jokes are plentiful, with Bullock finding chemistry with all of her co-stars. She's a very under valued comedy actress, and her ability to bond with an entire cast is marvellous to observe. Reference sexual tension with Benjamin Bratt, the jousting hostilities with Ernie Hudson, the way she bounces off of the other beautiful girls, and best of all the by-play with Michael Caine, who is playing a camp stylist and walks in to lift the laughter roof off the rafters in every scene he is in.

It doesn't push the boundaries of comedy, but it's thankfully a consistently funny piece of work, aided by a super cast on form who make a better comedy out of what the screenplay suggested it had any right to be. 7/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":199919,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2001-04-11","keywords":"beauty contest,fbi federal bureau of investigation,knee high boots,boots,pageant","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Miss Congeniality","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1980671001","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjAwNDcxYjQtOTNmMy00YzA3LWFhNmQtMGZkYjY5N2Y0Y2MyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjAwNDcxYjQtOTNmMy00YzA3LWFhNmQtMGZkYjY5N2Y0Y2MyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Miss Congeniality"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000113/","name":"Sandra Bullock"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000323/","name":"Michael Caine"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000973/","name":"Benjamin Bratt"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0677953/","name":"Donald Petrie"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040620/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108864/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0024939/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0492909/","name":"Marc Lawrence"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0974301/","name":"Katie Ford"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0524095/","name":"Caryn Lucas"}],"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="
